AzureEntityResource.description: The resource model definition for an Azure Resource Manager resource with an etag.
AzureEntityResource.title: Entity Resource

resource.description: The ID of the volume to use for this resource
The ID of the user-managed KeyVault to use

certificates.description: The KeyVault certificates that this volume exposes

keys.description: The KeyVault keys that this volume exposes

resource.description: The ID of the keyvault to use for this volume resource

secrets.description: The KeyVault secrets that this volume exposes

resource.description: The ID of the user-managed ServiceBus queue to use

BasicResourceProperties.description: Basic properties of a Radius resource.

alias.description: File name when written to disk.

value.description: Certificate object to be downloaded - the certificate itself, private key or public key of the certificate

name.description: The name of the resource for which availability needs to be checked.

message.description: Detailed reason why the given name is available.

nameAvailable.description: Indicates if the resource name is available.

reason.description: The reason why the given name is not available.

ContainerConnection.description: Specifies a connection from the container to another resource

roles.description: RBAC permissions to be assigned on the source resource

ContainerPort.description: Specifies a listening port for the container

protocol.description: Protocol in use by the port

provides.description: Specifies a route provided by this port

image.description: The registry and image to download and run in your container

ContainerResource.description: The radius.dev/Container resource provides an abstraction for a container workload that can be run on any Radius platform

appId.description: The Dapr appId used for the route

DaprInvokeHttpRouteResource.description: Resource that specifies an Dapr HTTP Service Invocation Route. A Dapr HTTP Service Invocation Route describes a pattern of communication between resources.

metadata.description: Metadata for the pub sub resource. This should match the values specified in Dapr component spec

type.description: Dapr PubSub type. These strings match the format used by Dapr Kubernetes configuration format.

kind.description: Radius kind for Dapr Secret Store

metadata.description: Metadata for the Secret Store resource. This should match the values specified in Dapr component spec

type.description: Dapr Secret Store type. These strings match the types defined in Dapr Component format: https://docs.dapr.io/reference/components-reference/supported-secret-stores/

DaprSidecarTrait.description: The specifies that the resource should have a Dapr sidecar injected

appId.description: The Dapr appId. Specifies the identifier used by Dapr for service invocation.

appPort.description: The Dapr appPort. Specifies the internal listening port for the application to handle requests from the Dapr sidecar.

config.description: Specifies the Dapr configuration to use for the resource.

protocol.description: Specifies the Dapr app-protocol to use for the resource.

provides.description: Specifies the resource id of a dapr.io.InvokeHttpRoute that can route traffic to this resource.

metadata.description: Metadata for the state store resource. This should match the values specified in Dapr component spec

type.description: Dapr StateStore type. These strings match the format used by Dapr Kubernetes configuration format.

EphemeralVolume.description: Specifies an ephemeral volume for a container

managedStore.description: Backing store for the ephemeral volume

mountPath.description: The path where the volume is mounted

ErrorAdditionalInfo.description: The resource management error additional info.

ErrorResponse.description: Common error response for all Azure Resource Manager APIs to return error details for failed operations. (This also follows the OData error response format.).
ErrorResponse.title: Error response

ExecHealthProbeProperties.description: Specifies the properties for readiness/liveness probe using an executable

command.description: Command to execute to probe readiness/liveness

failureThreshold.description: Threshold number of times the probe fails after which a failure would be reported

initialDelaySeconds.description: Initial delay in seconds before probing for readiness/liveness

periodSeconds.description: Interval for the readiness/liveness probe in seconds

protocol.description: The protocol to use for this listener.

GatewayResource.description: Resource that specifies how traffic is exposed to the application.

HttpGetHealthProbeProperties.description: Specifies the properties for readiness/liveness probe using HTTP Get

failureThreshold.description: Threshold number of times the probe fails after which a failure would be reported

headers.description: Custom HTTP headers to add to the get request

initialDelaySeconds.description: Initial delay in seconds before probing for readiness/liveness

path.description: The route to make the HTTP request on

periodSeconds.description: Interval for the readiness/liveness probe in seconds

HttpRouteGateway.description: Specifies configuration to allow public traffic from outside the network to the route. Configure a gateway to accept traffic from the internet.

hostname.description: Specifies the public hostname for the route. Use '*' to listen on all hostnames.

source.description: The gateway which this route is part of.

HttpRouteGatewayPath.description: Specifies path matching options to match requests on.

type.description: Specifies the path to match the incoming request.

value.description: Specifies the type of matching to match the path on. Supported values: 'prefix', 'exact'.

HttpRouteGatewayRule.description: Specifies the rule to match requests on.

method.description: Specifies the method to match on the incoming request.

hostname.description: The internal hostname accepting traffic for the route. Readonly.

port.description: The port number for the route. Defaults to 80.

scheme.description: The scheme used for traffic. Readonly.

url.description: A stable URL that that can be used to route traffic to a resource. Readonly.

HttpRouteResource.description: Resource that specifies an HTTP Route. An HTTP Route resource provides a stable URL that can be used to route internal or extrnal traffic to a resource.

principalId.description: The principal ID of resource identity.

alias.description: File name when written to disk.

identity.description: The client ID of the identity which will be used to access key vault.

keyIdentifier.description: Key vault uri to access the encryption key.

database.description: The name of the SQL database.

resource.description: The ID of the SQL database to use for this resource.

server.description: The fully qualified domain name of the SQL database.

host.description: The host name of the MongoDB to which you are connecting

port.description: The port value of the MongoDB to which you are connecting

resource.description: The ID of the DB with Mongo API to use for this resource.

connectionString.description: The connection string used to connect to this DB

password.description: The password for this MongoDB instance

username.description: The password for this MongoDB instance

MongoDatabaseResource.description: The mongo database resource is a portable resource which can be deployed to any Radius platform.

Operation.description: Details of a REST API operation, returned from the Resource Provider Operations API

actionType.description: Enum. Indicates the action type. "Internal" refers to actions that are for internal only APIs.

display.description: Localized display information for this particular operation.

description.description: The short, localized friendly description of the operation; suitable for tool tips and detailed views.

operation.description: The concise, localized friendly name for the operation; suitable for dropdowns. E.g. "Create or Update Virtual Machine", "Restart Virtual Machine".

provider.description: The localized friendly form of the resource provider name, e.g. "Microsoft Monitoring Insights" or "Microsoft Compute".

resource.description: The localized friendly name of the resource type related to this operation. E.g. "Virtual Machines" or "Job Schedule Collections".

isDataAction.description: Whether the operation applies to data-plane. This is "true" for data-plane operations and "false" for ARM/control-plane operations.

name.description: The name of the operation, as per Resource-Based Access Control (RBAC). Examples: "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/write", "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/capture/action"

origin.description: The intended executor of the operation; as in Resource Based Access Control (RBAC) and audit logs UX. Default value is "user,system"

Operation.title: REST API Operation

OperationListResult.description: A list of REST API operations supported by an Azure Resource Provider. It contains an URL link to get the next set of results.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of operation list results (if there are any).

value.description: List of operations supported by the resource provider

OperationStatusResult.description: The current status of an async operation.

endTime.description: The end time of the operation.

error.description: If present, details of the operation error.

id.description: Fully qualified ID for the async operation.

percentComplete.description: Percent of the operation that is complete.

startTime.description: The start time of the operation.

PersistentVolume.description: Specifies a persistent volume for a container

mountPath.description: The path where the volume is mounted

rbac.description: Container read/write access to the volume

name.description: A user defined name of the 3rd Party Artifact that is being procured.

product.description: The 3rd Party artifact that is being procured. E.g. NewRelic. Product maps to the OfferID specified for the artifact at the time of Data Market onboarding.

promotionCode.description: A publisher provided promotion code as provisioned in Data Market for the said product/artifact.

publisher.description: The publisher of the 3rd Party Artifact that is being bought. E.g. NewRelic

version.description: The version of the desired product/artifact.

ProxyResource.description: The resource model definition for a Azure Resource Manager proxy resource. It will not have tags and a location
ProxyResource.title: Proxy Resource

RabbitMQMessageQueueResource.description: The RabbitMQMessageQueue resource is a Kubernetes specific resource for message brokering.

connectionString.description: The connection string used to connect to this RabbitMQ instance

RadiusResource.description: Interface for generic resource -- useful for listing resources without specifying a type

RedisCacheResource.description: The RedisCache resource is a portable resource which can be deployed to any Radius platform.

host.description: The host name of the redis cache to which you are connecting

port.description: The port value of the redis cache to which you are connecting

resource.description: The ID of the Redis cache to use for this resource

connectionString.description: The Redis connection string used to connect to the redis cache

password.description: The password for this Redis instance

Resource.description: Common fields that are returned in the response for all Azure Resource Manager resources

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. Ex - /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

Resource.title: Resource

ResourceModelWithAllowedPropertySet.description: The resource model definition containing the full set of allowed properties for a resource. Except properties bag, there cannot be a top level property outside of this set.

etag.description: The etag field is *not* required. If it is provided in the response body, it must also be provided as a header per the normal etag convention.  Entity tags are used for comparing two or more entities from the same requested resource. HTTP/1.1 uses entity tags in the etag (section 14.19), If-Match (section 14.24), If-None-Match (section 14.26), and If-Range (section 14.27) header fields.

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. Ex - /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}

kind.description: Metadata used by portal/tooling/etc to render different UX experiences for resources of the same type; e.g. ApiApps are a kind of Microsoft.Web/sites type.  If supported, the resource provider must validate and persist this value.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

managedBy.description: The fully qualified resource ID of the resource that manages this resource. Indicates if this resource is managed by another Azure resource. If this is present, complete mode deployment will not delete the resource if it is removed from the template since it is managed by another resource.

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

alias.description: File name when written to disk.

Sku.description: The resource model definition representing SKU

capacity.description: If the SKU supports scale out/in then the capacity integer should be included. If scale out/in is not possible for the resource this may be omitted.

family.description: If the service has different generations of hardware, for the same SKU, then that can be captured here.

name.description: The name of the SKU. Ex - P3. It is typically a letter+number code

size.description: The SKU size. When the name field is the combination of tier and some other value, this would be the standalone code.

tier.description: This field is required to be implemented by the Resource Provider if the service has more than one tier, but is not required on a PUT.

TcpHealthProbeProperties.description: Specifies the properties for readiness/liveness probe using TCP

failureThreshold.description: Threshold number of times the probe fails after which a failure would be reported

initialDelaySeconds.description: Initial delay in seconds before probing for readiness/liveness

periodSeconds.description: Interval for the readiness/liveness probe in seconds

TrackedResource.description: The resource model definition for an Azure Resource Manager tracked top level resource which has 'tags' and a 'location'

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

TrackedResource.title: Tracked Resource

Volume.description: Specifies a volume for a container

VolumeResource.description: The Volume provides an abstraction for a volume that can be mounted to a container

encryptionProperties.description: Configuration of key for data encryption

status.description: Indicates whether or not the encryption is enabled for container registry.

locationData.description: Metadata pertaining to the geographic location of the resource.

city.description: The city or locality where the resource is located.

countryOrRegion.description: The country or region where the resource is located

district.description: The district, state, or province where the resource is located.

name.description: A canonical name for the geographic or physical location.

systemData.description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.description: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

info.description: APIs for deploying and managing applications with Radius.
info.title: RadiusClient

ApiVersionParameter.description: The API version to use for this operation.
ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version

ApplicationNameParameter.description: The name of the Application resource.
ApplicationNameParameter.name: applicationName

AzureKeyVaultNameParameter.description: The name of the azure.com.KeyVault resource.
AzureKeyVaultNameParameter.name: azureKeyVaultName

AzureServiceBusNameParameter.name: azureServiceBusName

ContainerNameParameter.description: The name of the Container resource.

GatewayNameParameter.description: The name of the Gateway resource.
GatewayNameParameter.name: gatewayName

HttpRouteNameParameter.description: The name of the HttpRoute resource.

MicrosoftSQLDatabaseNameParameter.description: The name of the microsoft.com.SQLDatabase resource.
MicrosoftSQLDatabaseNameParameter.name: microsoftSQLDatabaseName

MongoDatabaseNameParameter.description: The name of the mongo.com.MongoDatabase resource.
MongoDatabaseNameParameter.name: mongoDatabaseName

OperationIdParameter.description: The ID of an ongoing async operation.
OperationIdParameter.name: operationId

RabbitMQMessageQueueNameParameter.description: The name of the rabbitmq.com.MessageQueue resource.
RabbitMQMessageQueueNameParameter.name: rabbitMQMessageQueueName

RadiusResourceNameParameter.description: The name of the RadiusResource resource.
RadiusResourceNameParameter.name: radiusResourceName

RedisCacheNameParameter.description: The name of the redislabs.com.RedisCache resource.
RedisCacheNameParameter.name: redisCacheName

ResourceGroupNameParameter.description: The name of the resource group. The name is case insensitive.
ResourceGroupNameParameter.name: resourceGroupName

SubscriptionIdParameter.description: The ID of the target subscription.
SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId

VolumeNameParameter.description: The name of the Volume resource.
VolumeNameParameter.name: volumeName

get.description: List the Application resources deployed in the application.

200.description: The list of Application resources was retrieved successfully.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

202.description: The request to delete the Application will complete asynchronously.

204.description: The Application resource was successfully deleted.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets a Application resource by name.

200.description: The Application resource was retrieved successfully.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Creates or updates a Application resource.

parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the CreateOrUpdate operation of a Application resource.
parameters.name: parameters

200.description: The existing Application resource was successfully updated.

201.description: The new Application resource was successfully created.

202.description: The existing Application resource was successfully updated.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.
